intro: Leptogastrodia longitubularis, commonly known as the long-tubular leptogastrodia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant is characterized by its slender, tubular flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
